Title: Forgeable Public/Private Tokens
Description: "algorithm" isn't enforced in jwt.decode() and a malicious user could choose what algorithm is sent sent to the server. If the server is expecting RSA but is sent HMAC-SHA with RSA's public key, the server will think the public key is actually an HMAC private key. This could be used to forge any data an attacker wants.
Solution: Change jwt.decode() to include an algorithm parameter.
